description: Set information to display during cycling. Along with the baseline information, additional information can be displayed during cycling using the keywords below. This information will be updated every step.

keywords.name: active
keywords.description: Turn off or on the additional information in the cycle information. This is set to on automatically when one of the other keywords is specified

keywords.name: fish
keywords.description: Add the value of the FISH symbol s to the cycle output. A leading '@' is optional

keywords.name: history
keywords.description: Add the tabulated value of the history with ID i to the cycle output. Only the result of one history can be shown

notes: Information is updated every step during cycling
Additional information can be added via keywords
active is automatically set to on when other keywords are specified
FISH symbol: leading '@' character is optional
history limitation: only ONE history can be displayed at a time
Useful for monitoring specific values during long simulations
Display settings persist until changed or model new

examples.description: Display FISH variable with explicit '@' prefix (optional)
Display history ID 1 values during cycling

examples.command:
fish define max_velocity
  max_velocity = ball.vel.max
end
model display fish max_velocity
model cycle 1000
examples.description: Define FISH function, display its value during cycling

examples.command:
history id 1 unbalanced
model display history 1
model solve
examples.description: Create history, display it during solve

examples.command:
model display fish ratio
model cycle 10000
examples.description: Monitor unbalanced force ratio during cycling

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model display ...') - Python SDK does not provide display control. For monitoring, use print statements or logging in Python loop with itasca.cycle() and itasca.fish_get()
